message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.DS

The paper deals with the specification and verification of reachability properties in separation logic, which is a formalism for reasoning about the correctness of programs that manipulate heap-allocated data structures. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Logic (cs.LO), Programming Languages (cs.PL), Software Engineering (cs.SE), Formal Languages and Automata Theory (cs.FL), or Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-categories. Among these, cs.LO and cs.PL are the most likely, as they are the most closely related to the topics of separation logic and program verification. However, cs.SE is also a strong possibility, as the paper emphasizes the practical applicability of the proposed technique to concurrent programs. Finally, cs.FL and cs.DS are less likely, but still plausible, as the paper deals with formal reasoning about the structure of heap-allocated data structures.
